articles.headline: How the Wealthy World Has Failed Poor Countries During the Pandemic
articles.snippet: Despite pledges for debt relief and expanded programs, the World Bank and International Monetary Fund have delivered meager aid, say economists.
articles.abstract: Despite pledges for debt relief and expanded programs, the World Bank and International Monetary Fund have delivered meager aid, say economists.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Like much of the developing world, Pakistan was alarmingly short of doctors and medical facilities long before anyone had heard of Covid-19. Then the pandemic overwhelmed hospitals, forcing some to turn away patients. As fear upended daily life, families lost livelihoods and struggled to feed themselves.

articles.headline: Election at Hand, Biden Leads Trump in Four Key States, Poll Shows
articles.snippet: Joseph R. Biden Jr. leads President Trump in Pennsylvania, Florida, Arizona and, by a wide margin, in Wisconsin, according to a Times/Siena College poll.
articles.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr. leads President Trump in Pennsylvania, Florida, Arizona and, by a wide margin, in Wisconsin, according to a Times/Siena College poll.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election. Read our story]
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Dishonesty Has Defined the Trump Presidency. The Consequences Could Be Lasting.
articles.snippet: Whether President Trump wins or loses on Nov. 3, the very concept of public trust in an established set of facts necessary for the operation of a democratic society has been eroded.
articles.abstract: Whether President Trump wins or loses on Nov. 3, the very concept of public trust in an established set of facts necessary for the operation of a democratic society has been eroded.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Born amid made-up crowd size claims and “alternative facts,” the Trump presidency has been a factory of falsehood from the start, churning out distortions, conspiracy theories and brazen lies at an assembly-line pace that has challenged fact-checkers and defied historical analogy.

articles.headline: He Already Saw the Election as Good vs. Evil. Then His Tractor Burned.
articles.snippet: In Nebraska, President Trump’s supporters hope he wins a second term, and that they get four more years of feeling like the country’s leader understands and defends them.
articles.abstract: In Nebraska, President Trump’s supporters hope he wins a second term, and that they get four more years of feeling like the country’s leader understands and defends them.
articles.lead_paragraph: HENDERSON, Neb. — Jonathan Rempel has never been a loudmouth around town about his politics, but his views are clear when he asks rhetorical questions like, “Have you ever got a job from a poor person?” Or when he says that taxes are a form of extortion. They show up on Facebook, where some of his posts support gun rights and criticize a welfare state.

articles.headline: In San Francisco, Virus Is Contained but Schools Are Still Closed
articles.snippet: A debate over reopening classrooms pits the mayor against the Board of Education, cutting across class, party and racial lines.
articles.abstract: A debate over reopening classrooms pits the mayor against the Board of Education, cutting across class, party and racial lines.

articles.headline: Trump, Venezuela and the Tug-of-War Over a Strongman
articles.snippet: How a yearslong battle over U.S.-Venezuela relations aided President Trump’s campaign in Florida — and left the Maduro regime standing.
articles.abstract: How a yearslong battle over U.S.-Venezuela relations aided President Trump’s campaign in Florida — and left the Maduro regime standing.
articles.lead_paragraph: When President Trump turned to the Capitol gallery during his State of the Union speech in February to recognize Venezuela’s young opposition leader, Juan Guaidó, it seemed like a political masterstroke.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore, Anatoly Kurmanaev and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: In Dash to Finish, Biden and Trump Set Up Showdown in Pennsylvania
articles.snippet: Both campaigns were intensifying their efforts in a state increasingly critical to victory, as the candidates and their surrogates planned a final blitz to make their closing arguments.
articles.abstract: Both campaigns were intensifying their efforts in a state increasingly critical to victory, as the candidates and their surrogates planned a final blitz to make their closing arguments.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election. Read our story]
articles.byline: By Katie Glueck and Annie Karni

articles.headline: It’s the End of an Era for the Media, No Matter Who Wins the Election
articles.snippet: Trump made the legacy media great again. Here’s what’s next for them.
articles.abstract: Trump made the legacy media great again. Here’s what’s next for them.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Follow our live coverage of Election night and Trump and Biden results]

articles.headline: In Hunt for Virus Source, W.H.O. Let China Take Charge
articles.snippet: As it praised Beijing, the World Health Organization concealed concessions to China and may have sacrificed the best chance to unravel the virus’s origins. Now it’s a favorite Trump attack line.
articles.abstract: As it praised Beijing, the World Health Organization concealed concessions to China and may have sacrificed the best chance to unravel the virus’s origins. Now it’s a favorite Trump attack line.

articles.headline: What to Expect From Facebook, Twitter and YouTube on Election Day
articles.snippet: The sites are key conduits for communication and information. Here’s how they plan to handle the challenges facing them before, on and after Tuesday.
articles.abstract: The sites are key conduits for communication and information. Here’s how they plan to handle the challenges facing them before, on and after Tuesday.

articles.byline: By Mike Isaac, Kate Conger and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: The Quiet Architect of Biden’s Plan to Rescue the Economy
articles.snippet: Ben Harris is not a household name, even in economics. But he helped develop a package of tax and spending increases that has not spooked Wall Street.
articles.abstract: Ben Harris is not a household name, even in economics. But he helped develop a package of tax and spending increases that has not spooked Wall Street.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In recent months Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s campaign developed a virtual road show to reassure executives, investment fund managers and financiers who were nervous that the Democratic candidate’s plans to increase taxes could hurt the American economic recovery.

articles.headline: Win or Lose, Trump and Biden’s Parties Will Plunge Into Uncertainty
articles.snippet: No matter who wins, Democrats will be split between younger progressives and a moderate old guard. And a Republican Party redefined in President Trump’s image will start weighing where it goes next.
articles.abstract: No matter who wins, Democrats will be split between younger progressives and a moderate old guard. And a Republican Party redefined in President Trump’s image will start weighing where it goes next.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Joe Biden has won the 2020 U.S. presidential election. Read our story]
